title: Why does Lol pander to the pros and diamond+ when its gold, silver, and bronze are MOST PLAYERS
body: why?  whats the meaning of this. it seams you are just like US gov.  If money is involved then that's who we please, no wonder so many people are playing other games.  Enjoy your worlds, its great, I watch it too.  However, if you don't play like them, the game fucking sucks.  I played for 2 or 3 years and stopped in 2014.  I came back after that time, and now the game is horribly designed for the pros.  You guys used to be a company that cared about players.  Now its just income, that's fine all other corps do that.  You guys have become something that's not fun anymore.  You guys saved me from WoW but I might as well have stayed. I am not complaining that hard, all I want to know is, why is the majority of players discounted when it comes to balance?  sorry we don't make you money?

replies.body: because everything stomps in low elo
I think the answer is: because if they balanced around what we normies play like, the pros could easily exploit those changes. I'm probably wrong, but I think that's what I've heard.

Because people who are low ELO don't know shit about balance and it's not even relevant to them.
Champs they think are "OP" are usually just them being bad at the game and not knowing how to play against them.
bc all they give a fuck about is their prescious LCS that noone else gives two shits about

The pros think the game is in a bad state itself... On another note, if they didn't balance the champions around the pros then the pros would just abuse the balances made around the people that don't understand the game (majority of players) and they'd be even harder to climb against. It makes sense to balance around the people who have "mastered" the game. Think it through before you post.
